wikipedia_page.main: Ernest Hayes  was a Corporal in the British Army. He was awarded the Military Medal three times for his conduct in World War I. He was one of only 180 men out of 115,600 to be awarded the Medal three times for his actions in that conflict.

response: *Ernest Hayes (1898–1938): a three-time Military Medal winner in the First World War, he died in Beeston.

*Ernest Hayes (1898–1938), born in Gripps Cottage, Cotgrave, joined the Kings Own Yorkshire Light Infantry in 1916 and received the Military Medal three times for bravery on the Western Front (France) in 1918.
* Ernest Hayes (engineer) (1851–1933), New Zealand engineer and inventor
